description.narrative: The National Council of Churches of Kenya through its peace building and conflict management thematic area has since 2008 been facilitating ethnic communities to engage in intra and inter-ethnic dialogue forums to help them identify the main causes of the periodic ethnic conflicts at the same time identifying home-grown solutions to such issues all in a bid to promote cohesion and integration among Kenyan ethnic communities. In late 2013 the Danish Embassy in Nairobi gave the council a 2 year grant to support these noble efforts. In this regard a programme dubbed Pomona Initiative was rolled out with the intention of strengthening the framework for peace and reconciliation between key ethnic groups in Kenya by creating safe spaces for open dialogue and consensus building amongst the ethnic communities in conflict.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
